result.execSummary:
All charges against Isaac G Michalski in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaac G Michalski is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac G Michalski

records.addlTxt: Findings and Order to Dismiss Without Prejudice signed and filed.

Defendant Isaac G Michalski in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Isaac G Michalski.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Final Pretrial. Discussion held regarding State's Motion to Adjourn.  Defense objects and moves for an order to exclude state's expert witnesses and drugs relating to this matter. For the reasons stated on the record, the Court DISMISSES this matter, without prejudice.  	Any cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it and the Defendant is released from any terms of bond.
State's Notice of and Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial, filed.

Defendant Isaac G Michalski in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are still negotiating, the State is requesting additional time. Court is setting case for trial for reasons stated on the record. Court sets the following deadlines:
- 08/26/2022: deadline for the State to complete and turnover all crime lab reports to the defense. 
- 10/03/2022: deadline to file any change of plea forms.
- 10/10/2022: deadline for filing any final pretrial documents, including written stipulations of fact.
- 10/18/2022: final day that the Court will accept negotiated resolution.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse. Cas e is adjourned for jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Isaac G Michalski in court with attorney Ashley Fard for Brett Copeland.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court set the following filing deadlines with parties. State has until June 3rd, 2022, to turnover all discovery except for crime lab reports to defense. Defense has until June 22nd, 2022 to file any motions and/or change of plea forms. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Isaac G Michalski in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 06CF3991. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Parks. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Isaac G Michalski in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Isaac G Michalski in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Elizabeth A Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/21/22 @ 2p
Actual Date Bond Posted with Milwaukee County Sheriff on 10/31/21.
